landing.titleText: The Day the School Got Slimed
landing.descriptionText: Explore how to use subjects outside of school.

exercises.titleText: The Secret About Subjects
exercises.subtitleText: What can school subjects teach you about yourself?

config.subtitleText: What can school subjects teach you about yourself?

speechBubbles.bubbleText:
“That's 3 points!” Pep cheered to the empty gym. He was running his daily basketball drill.
<hr/>
“Pep! We’ve been looking for you,” Dart huffed. He and Newt pushed a cart jammed with beakers full of stinky, bubbling mixtures. They swerved around a giant pile of dirty gym socks.
<hr/>
Newt cried, “Our science project is due today! Put down that basketball and give us a hand.”

Pep bounced the ball, slightly annoyed. “I don’t have time for science.”
<hr/>
Dart piped up, “But this experiment is going to be so cool!”
<hr/>
“Okay, just one more shot!” said Pep. The ball bounced off the rim and crashed into the cart. The potions splashed all over the gym socks.

“Our experiment is ruined!” Newt cried. “We’ll have to start over.”
<hr/>
“Can you guys handle it?” Pep begged. “I’m busy perfecting my 3-pointer!” 
<hr/>
“Uhhh guys,” Dart blurted, “What’s that!?” Newt and Pep turned and saw the pile of potion-covered gear. It was growing! And glowing! It let out a loud burp.

Newt peered at the strange creature. “Fascinating. I’m taking a sample.” She gently smeared some of the stinky green goop into a tube. “To the science lab!”
<hr/>
Pep shrugged. “Nah. I think I’ll stay and shoot hoops!” At that, the slime creature erupted. In a giant wave, it flowed out of the gym and down the hall.
<hr/>
“You are coming with us,” Dart insisted. “And we need to go NOW.”

As the friends ran down the hall, they saw that the creature had slimed all of the other students. Everyone was frozen in green goop!
<hr/>
They burst into the science lab and Newt found a microscope. She zoomed in on the goop sample. "The creature is alive and growing!" Newt gasped.
<hr/>
Pep peered through the microscope. “You used science to figure that out? Cool!” The green goop seemed to shudder and shrink from the science lab.

“Did you see that?” Dart cried. “The creature didn’t like that Pep learned something new about science!”
<hr/>
“Let's try using other subjects to fix this slime monster situation,” said Newt. Dart and Pep nodded eagerly.
<hr/>
“I’ve learned from gym and health class that teamwork helps to solve problems,” Pep suggested. “Let’s be a team and find out where the monster is going!”

speechBubble.bubbleText: Eww, the monster has slimed all the books!
Maybe learning more about school subjects will help us defeat this thing!

landing.descriptionText: Find the facts about school subjects.
landing.descriptionAltText: Find the facts about school subjects.

hub.titleText: The monster is headed for the library!
hub.descriptionText: Stop the slime creature from glowing and growing.

exercises.titleText: Pick the TRUE Statement about school subjects

options.shortText: Studying different subjects makes it confusing to learn
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: A subject is a group of related information and ideas
options.answerText: Yes! You stunned the creature!

options.shortText: Your teacher decides which subjects are most important
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: There are different subjects to match the rooms in your school
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

exercises.titleText: Pick the TRUE Statement about school subjects

options.shortText: Some subjects only cover one topic
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: Some subjects are hard for everyone
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: You should enjoy every topic in your favourite subject
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: Each subject has many topics to explore
options.answerText: That's it! The creature has stopped growing!

exercises.titleText: Pick the TRUE Statement about school subjects

options.shortText: You will use every subject outside of school
options.answerText: Right on! The creature has stopped glowing!

options.shortText: You won’t use any subjects outside of school
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: You will only have to use your favourite subject when you’re an adult
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: You shouldn’t pick a favourite subject, the other subjects will feel sad
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

exercises.titleText: Pick the TRUE Statement about school subjects

options.shortText: Subjects you like now will be the same subjects you’ll like in middle school
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: Subjects you like can lead to new interests, hobbies, and jobs
options.answerText: Super! The creature is leaving the library!

options.shortText: You can’t do well at subjects you don’t like
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: Some subjects are more likely to make you rich one day
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

summary.titleText: Here's the truth about school subjects:

image.subTitleText: The facts made the slime monster squirm. It has retreated from the library!

speechBubble.bubbleText: The monster is headed back to the science lab!
Let's see if we can use all the subjects to unstick the students!

landing.descriptionText: Spot some ways to use subjects outside of school.
landing.descriptionAltText: Spot some ways to use subjects outside of school.

hub.titleText: Yuck! The creature is spreading slime everywhere.
hub.descriptionText: De-slime each room so the students can get back to learning.

exercises.titleText: Pick 1 way you can use science outside of school.

options.shortText: Sprouting seeds to grow a plant in a window
options.answerText: Way to grow! How plants grow is a science topic.

options.shortText: You can only use science in a science lab
options.answerText: Hmm...pretty sure science can be used in all kinds of places.

options.shortText: Watching a video about a mad scientist
options.answerText: Hmm...don't think that counts as using science.

options.shortText: Counting the number of steps to a friend’s house
options.answerText: Hmm...sounds more like math than science.

exercises.titleText: Pick 1 way you can use gym and health outside of school.

options.shortText: Reading a comic about superheroes
options.answerText: Hmm...pretty sure reading is a language arts topic.

options.shortText: Washing your hands before you eat
options.answerText: Slam dunk! Personal hygiene is a gym and health topic.

options.shortText: Measuring how much food to give a pet
options.answerText: Hmm...seems like that's using math rather than gym and health.

options.shortText: Playing a theme song on the piano
options.answerText: Hmm...sounds like you're using art and music.

exercises.titleText: Pick 1 way you can use art and music outside of school.

options.shortText: Collecting different types of rocks on a hike
options.answerText: Hmm...pretty sure you're using science when sorting rocks.

options.shortText: Talking with a friend about the best movie
options.answerText: Hmm...you're using language arts when you reason why a movie is the best.

options.shortText: Painting a picture to give as a gift
options.answerText: Art star! Painting is an art and music topic.

options.shortText: Making a campfire to roast marshmallows
options.answerText: Hmm...not unless you consider a campfire a work of art.

exercises.titleText: LEVEL UP!
exercises.subTitleText: Now pick 2 ways you can use subjects outside of school.

exercises.titleText: Pick 2 ways you can use social studies outside of school.

options.shortText: Making a necklace out of beads and string
options.answerText: Hmm...pretty sure that's using art skills.

options.shortText: Scoring a goal in a soccer game
options.answerText: Hmm...when you play sports you are using gym and health.

options.shortText: Finding your location on a map
options.answerText: X marks the spot! Map reading is a social studies topic.

options.shortText: Playing a trivia game about facts from history
options.answerText: Time traveller! History is a social studies topic.

exercises.titleText: Pick 2 ways you can use language arts outside of school.

options.shortText: Writing a letter to a penpal
options.answerText: Word whiz! Writing is a language arts topic.

options.shortText: Chatting with your family at dinnertime
options.answerText: Great point! Communicating is a language arts topic.

options.shortText: Doing cartwheels in a gymnastics class
options.answerText: Hmm...pretty sure doing cartwheels is using gym and health.

options.shortText: Building a model airplane
options.answerText: Hmm...don't think language arts is the subject you'd need most.

exercises.titleText: Pick 2 ways you can use math and computers outside of school.

options.shortText: Volunteering to pick up garbage at a park
options.answerText: Hmm...not unless you're counting all the garbage you collect.

options.shortText: Paying the right amount of money at a store
options.answerText: This adds up! Counting is a math and computers topic.

options.shortText: Reading the temperature to see if you need a jacket
options.answerText: Red hot! Telling the temperature is a math and computers topic.

options.shortText: Finding a different country on a globe
options.answerText: Hmm...pretty sure that's using social studies.

image.subTitleText: Way to de-slime the school! The students are free to learn again.

summary.titleText: Check out some of the ways you can use subjects outside of school:

speechBubble.bubbleText: We’ve got the monster cornered! Now what?!
Let’s blast it with all the things we like about our favourite subjects. That might make it shrivel!

hub.descriptionText: Shrink this goopy mess down to size!

summary.titleText: Here's what you said about your favourite subject:

image.subTitleText: The creature is...smiling?! Looks like your love of learning rubbed off!

results.questionText: What motivated you to keep going?
What did you learn about perseverance?

speechBubble.bubbleText: Did you know that the subjects you like best can lead you to a future job?
I think its name is Glerb!

landing.descriptionText: Find some careers that use your favourite subject.
landing.descriptionAltText: Find some careers that use your favourite subject.

hub.titleText: The creature is no longer quite so stinky and slimy!
hub.descriptionText: Feed it more knowledge in this final mission.

options.answerText: Awesome! Art and music therapists know about different types of art or music to use with clients.
Hmm...try again.

Hmm...try again.
Right! Mathematicans know math rules and how to create them.
Hmm...try again.
Right! Bicycle mechanics know about bike safety.
Hmm...try again.
Nice! Gardeners know how to grow and take care of plants.
Hmm...try again.
Right! Judges know about laws and court rules.
Hmm...try again.

options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

Hmm...try again.
Great! Zookeepers talk to zoo visitors and write notes about animal behaviour.
Hmm...try again.
Great! Bank tellers count money quickly and avoid mistakes.
Hmm...try again.
Great! Waiters spend a lot of time walking and carry heavy trays.
Hmm...try again.
Right! Family physicians know about how the human body works.

Great! Foresters understand laws about the environment.

options.answerText: Hmm...try again.
Right! Hairstylists create trendy hairstyles using different colours and shapes.
Hmm...try again.
Right! Interior designers talk to clients about designs.

Right! Fishers keep fit and strong to haul in heavy nets.

Awesome! Astronauts study how objects act in space with no gravity.

exercises.titleText: Pick the career that uses {{titleText}}.

options.answerText: Great! Architects sketch designs that clients like.
Hmm...try again.
Nice! Real estate agents read and write offers to buy or sell properties.
Hmm...try again.
Nice! Chefs multiply and divide to figure out how much food is needed.

Nice! Dancers understand how the human body moves, and how to keep it healthy.

summary.titleText: Check out all the ways you'd face some big challenges:

image.subTitleText: With perseverance like yours, Marsh is as good as rescued!

speechBubbles.bubbleText: The friends and the creature rushed outside. They wanted to help their new friend keep learning, but Glerb was still pretty slimy.<hr/>Dart gasped, “We de-slimed the school. Now students can learn again!”<hr/>Pep suddenly remembered their experiment. “Hey Glerb, would you teach us about your species?”<hr/>Glerb nodded and gave a goopy green grin. “Looks like Glerb is all for it!” shouted Newt.

“Pep, do you still think that gym and health is the only subject you need?” Dart asked.<hr/>Pep admitted, “Learning about all of the subjects really comes in handy. We used them in ways I never suspected!”<hr/>Newt chimed in, “Especially teamwork!” She high-fived everyone, even Glerb. Flecks of slime went flying.<hr/>Dart winked at his pals. “But what did we really learn today?” The friends laughed and yelled, “Wash your stinky socks!”

summary.descriptionText: You de-slimed the school so the students (and Glerb!) could learn!
summary.subHeadingText: You can study up on subjects any time:
